conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine the maximum distance between Car A and Car B.

Both cars start at t = 0 with zero velocity. At t = 10 seconds, Car A reaches a constant speed of 40 m/s and maintains it until t = 30 seconds. Car B accelerates linearly from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds, reaching a speed of 80 m/s at t = 30 seconds. The two cars are side by side at t = 30 seconds.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A up to t = 30 seconds.
Car A accelerates uniformly from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds with an acceleration of 4 m/s².
Distance traveled by Car A during acceleration is 200 m.
From t = 10 to t = 30 seconds, Car A travels at a constant speed of 40 m/s, covering 800 m.
Total distance traveled by Car A is 1000 m.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B up to t = 30 seconds.
Car B accelerates uniformly from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds with an acceleration of 8/3 m/s².
Distance traveled by Car B is 1200 m.
Determine the time when the cars are side by side initially (before t = 30 s).
Distance traveled by Car A up to t1 is 200 m + 40(t1 - 10) m.
Distance traveled by Car B up to t1 is (1/2) * (8/3) * t1².
